rationale: Includes “Risperidone 25 mg intramuscular suspension, extended release, administered today, covering for four weeks,” but does not specify deltoid site.
Explicitly states “No tablets unless otherwise instructed,” matching clinician’s directive.
Mentions recycling old bottles, but omits pt’s missed doses, color change confusion, and reassurance that white 2-mg generic is equivalent.
Gives guidance to limit melatonin to one 5-mg gummy, yet omits the accidental 10-mg ingestion and clinician assurance of safety/daytime grogginess comment.
Orders prolactin, kidney, liver labs for Tuesday the 14th before 3 p.m.; fully matches detail requested.
Lists both suggested behavioral aids: two phone alarms and Disability Services visual board.
Note contains no statement about ongoing sleep disturbance despite melatonin.
Captures most key items but misses several details (missed doses, color confusion, melatonin overdose context, sleep complaint).
Does not introduce incorrect doses/meds; minor neutral additions (ICD code) acceptable.
No irrelevant chart copy such as ROS/PE or wrong melatonin strength; aligns with transcript.
